comment.author: 48702688@N05
comment._content:
What's more many Irish citizens served in the British armed forces or worked in the British war industry during the war.
Ireland maintained armed neutrality during WW2 (State of Emergency for the Irish authorities), entering the war as British allies was not considered feasable or acceptable due to the Northern Irish question and to the still very recent events of the Irish war of liberation against the UK and the Civil War.

comment.author: 32921850@N00
comment._content: Then as now it was possible for Irish nationals (from the Republic of Ireland) to join the British army.
